data.description: ABOUT ADVANCED ENERGY Advanced Energy (Nasdaq: AEIS) is a global leader in the design and manufacturing of highly engineered, precision power conversion, measurement and control solutions for mission-critical applications and processes. AE’s power solutions enable customer innovation in complex applications for a wide range of industries including semiconductor equipment, industrial, manufacturing, telecommunications, data center computing and healthcare. Advanced Energy has devoted four decades to perfecting power for its global customers and is headquartered in Denver, Colorado. WHY BE A PART OF ADVANCED ENERGY? Some people say it’s like working in the best of two worlds. We operate like an agile, growing, small company – you can see your work make a difference to the company every day. Things move quickly and you can see and feel it. At the same time, we’re a global company founded in 1981 and have been publicly traded for more than 28 years. We have a strong cash position, deep trust and partnership with leading customers, a global best-in-class operations capability, and a proven leadership team. We have a track record and resources to make things happen both organically and inorganically. Being part of a nimble company with a solid foundation attracts team members that are capable, driven and like a challenge. Our employees collaborate and know how to have fun inventing, working, building and winning together. At our core, we are Advanced Energy – powering the future, together. POSITION SUMMARY: The Data Analytics Intern will support the predictive failure analysis initiative by managing and acquiring data from multiple sources (testing, SPC, RMA, production, etc.). The intern will work closely with the data scientist to understand stakeholder requirements, build data models, perform correlation studies and apply big data analytics techniques. The role includes identifying failure signatures and developing algorithms to detect abnormalities, contributing to advanced predictive analytics for manufacturing quality improvement. RESPONSIBILITIES: Collect, clean, and organize large datasets from various sources (SPC, RMA, production, testing). Work with stakeholders to understand analytical requirements & translate them into data models. Perform statistical analysis and correlation studies to identify patterns and root causes. Apply big data analytics techniques to extract insights and trends. Develop algorithms for anomaly detection and predictive failure analysis. Document processes, findings, and models for knowledge sharing and future reference. Support continuous improvement initiatives through data-driven insights WORK ENVIRONMENT: Location: Fort Collins, Colorado Environment: The candidate will work in a fast-paced office environment and will use general office equipment and software: phone, PC, Microsoft Office 365 Suite. QUALIFICATIONS: Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Proficiency in Python, R, or similar programming languages for data analysis. Knowledge of SQL and database management. Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling. Ability to visualize data using tools like R, Python, Power BI, Tableau or similar. Excellent communication and documentation skills. EXPERIENCE: Prior exposure to data analytics projects (academic or internship) preferred. Experience with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark) is a plus Knowledge of manufacturing and quality concepts is a plus EDUCATION: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related field COMPENSATION: As required by multiple state pay transparency laws, Advanced Energy provides a reasonable range of compensation for each job posting. Actual compensation is influenced by an array of factors including, but not limited to, skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. The range of starting pay for this role is $19 to $29 per hour. BENEFITS: As part of our total rewards philosophy, we believe in offering and maintaining competitive compensation and benefits programs for our employees to attract and retain a talented, highly engaged workforce. Our compensation programs are focused on equitable, fair pay practices including market-based base pay, an annual pay-for-performance incentive plan, and discounted Employee Stock Purchase Plan. In addition to our competitive compensation practices, we offer a strong benefits package in each of the countries in which we operate. In the U.S., we offer a rich benefits package that includes: Medical - multiple medical plans are available to choose from Short and long-term disability and life insurance Health savings and flexible spending accounts Generous time off policy starting with 3 weeks of paid vacation, 7 days of paid sick time, and 12 paid holidays 8 hours of paid volunteer time off 8 weeks of paid parental leave for both Moms and Dads Company matched 401(k) Tuition reimbursement Expanded mental health coverage and employee assistance programs Other voluntary benefits include critical illness, accident and hospital indemnity, pet insurance, identify theft, and legal assistance Advanced Energy is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities. Advanced Energy is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application process/procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance in completing an Advanced Energy application, please reach out to HumanResources@aei.com. CO ONLY: Applications will be accepted through 1/24/2026, the company reserves the right to review applications at any point after they are submitted.
